description: Wondering how to cook salmon and master crispy skin? This salmon recipe is sure to impress your friends and family. Serve with potatoes and herbed green peas.
keywords: Fish dishes,Pescatarian,Low salt,Lemon,Video,Low sugar,Summer,Potato,Microwave,High protein,High fibre,Wheat free,Mar 2021,Autumn,Nikki P,Salmon
name: Crispy Skin Salmon With Smashed Potatoes & Peas Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 0.5 bunch continental parsley, leaves roughly chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place salmon on a large plate and pat dry with paper towel. Generously season skin with salt and set aside until ready to cook.

Microwave potatoes according to packet instructions. Transfer potatoes to tray, then lightly crush with a fork. Drizzle with 2 tbs oil and bake for 25 minutes, turning once, or until golden brown and crispy.

Meanwhile, pat salmon skin dry again with paper towel, then drizzle with 2 tbs oil. Heat a large frying pan over medium-high heat, then add 2 salmon fillets, skin-sides down, and cook for 4 minutes, pressing flesh down with a spatula. Turn, then cook for a further 1 minute or until just cooked through. Repeat with remaining salmon fillets.

Meanwhile, place peas in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave, covered, on high for 3 minutes or until bright green and tender. Using a fork, crush peas, then add mint, parsley, lemon juice and remaining oil. Season and stir to combine
Serve salmon with potatoes and pea mixture.
